intro: Masdevallia erythrochaete, commonly known as the red-hair orchid, is a tropical orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, hairy inflorescence and vibrant red petals, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded forest environments. Its flowers bloom in late summer and are known for their intricate, often fragrant structure. Masdevallia erythrochaete is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and unique appearance.
